relation: Advanced Theories and Techniques of Counseling
Adventure Based Counseling with Children and Adolescents
Internship in Child and Adolescent Counseling
pageTitle: Child and Adolescent | William Carey University
textBeforeTable: Students in the Child and Adolescent Concentration must complete a total of 60 credit hours to satisfy requirements for the degree. Of that number, 51 hours are required core courses. Some core content areas allow students the flexibility of selecting from two or more course options. These selected content areas are denoted below by an asterisk. Core Courses (51 credit hours) Child and Adolescent MESSAGE Degrees Offered Psychology & Counseling » Natural & Behavioral Sciences » Academics » Home » You are here
textAfterTable: The Child and Adolescent Concentration requires an additional 9 hours of elective coursework. A range of courses can satisfy the elective requirement and must be selected with guidance from the student’s faculty advisor.  Common electives for the Child and Adolescent Concentration are below. Electives (9 credit hours) Number Credits Title PSY 641 3 Crisis Counseling PSY 648 3 Consultation: Theory, Models and Practices PSY 651 3 Drug and Alcohol Abuse Counseling **The above plan of study is only an example and does not serve as a degree application. Upon admission to the program, a student must review the requirements outlined in the current Graduate Catalog and meet with her/his assigned faculty advisor to develop a degree plan. All applications for degree must be approved by the faculty advisor and dean. Official degree applications can be obtained from the faculty advisor or Registrar.
